topics.title: OSI Model & TCP/IP
topics.note: The 7 layers vs 4 layers. Understand where HTTP (L7) and TCP (L4) sit and why it matters for Load Balancing.

topics.title: TCP vs UDP
topics.note: Reliability (Three-way handshake) vs Speed (Fire and forget). Use cases: Streaming vs Banking.

topics.title: DNS Resolution
topics.note: How a URL becomes an IP. A/AAAA records, TTL, and why DNS is the first layer of load balancing.

topics.title: HTTP/1.1 vs HTTP/2 vs HTTP/3
topics.note: Keep-alive connections, Multiplexing (HOL blocking), and QUIC (UDP-based web).

topics.title: WebSockets & Polling
topics.note: Real-time comms: Short Polling (bad) vs Long Polling vs Full-duplex WebSockets (Chat apps).

topics.title: REST vs GraphQL vs gRPC
topics.note: Resource-based (REST) vs Query-based (GraphQL) vs Procedure-based (gRPC/Protobufs).

topics.title: Idempotency
topics.note: Ensuring retrying a payment request doesn't charge the user twice (Idempotency Keys).

topics.title: Webhooks
topics.note: Don't call us, we'll call you. Event-driven updates between decoupled systems (e.g., Stripe payments).

topics.title: CAP Theorem
topics.note: Pick two: Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance. (Spoiler: In distributed systems, P is mandatory).

topics.title: PACELC Theorem
topics.note: An extension of CAP: If there is no Partition (P), how do you trade off Latency (L) vs Consistency (C)?

topics.title: Strong vs Eventual Consistency
topics.note: Banking needs Strong (ACID); Social Media feeds can survive with Eventual (BASE).

topics.title: Latency vs Throughput
topics.note: Speed of one request (Latency) vs volume of requests handled (Throughput).

topics.title: Push vs Pull Architecture
topics.note: Push: Low latency but can overwhelm clients. Pull: Client controls rate but data is stale.

topics.title: Stateful vs Stateless
topics.note: Stateless scales horizontally easily (JWT). Stateful sticks users to servers (Sessions).

topics.title: Load Balancing Algorithms
topics.note: Round Robin, Least Connections, and Weighted Round Robin.

topics.title: Consistent Hashing
topics.note: Adding/removing servers without remapping all keys. Critical for distributed caches (DynamoDB, Cassandra).

topics.title: Rate Limiting
topics.note: Protecting services from DDOS or noisy neighbors. Token Bucket vs Leaky Bucket algorithms.

topics.title: API Gateway vs Reverse Proxy
topics.note: Gateway handles auth, rate limiting, routing (business logic). Proxy just forwards traffic.

topics.title: Caching Strategies
topics.note: Cache-aside (Lazy), Write-through (Consistency), Write-back (Performance risk).

topics.title: Eviction Policies (LRU/LFU)
topics.note: How to decide what to delete when memory is full. LRU is standard, LFU for frequency.

topics.title: CDNs
topics.note: Serving static assets (images, CSS) from the edge, closer to the user.

topics.title: ACID Transactions
topics.note: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability. The holy grail of Relational DBs.

topics.title: Indexes (B-Tree vs LSM)
topics.note: B-Tree (Read heavy, MySQL) vs LSM Tree (Write heavy, Cassandra/Kafka).

topics.title: Bloom Filters
topics.note: Probabilistic structure to quickly tell if an item definitely DOES NOT exist (saves disk lookups).

topics.title: Sharding & Partitioning
topics.note: Horizontal scaling for DBs. Choosing a Shard Key to avoid 'Hot Partitions'.

topics.title: Replication (Master-Slave vs Multi-Master)
topics.note: Reading from Slaves (eventual consistency) vs Writing to Master. Multi-master handles conflict resolution.

topics.title: CDC (Change Data Capture)
topics.note: Turning the DB into an event stream (Debezium). Syncing DB to Search/Cache in real-time.

topics.title: Distributed Locking
topics.note: Ensuring only one process modifies a resource at a time (Redis Redlock, ZooKeeper).

topics.title: Consensus Algorithms (Paxos/Raft)
topics.note: How distributed nodes agree on a single source of truth (Leader Election).

topics.title: Gossip Protocol
topics.note: How nodes spread information (like heartbeats) in a cluster (Cassandra/Dynamo) without a master.

topics.title: Circuit Breaker
topics.note: Stop calling a failing service to prevent cascading failures (Resilience4j).

topics.title: Bulkhead Pattern
topics.note: Isolating resources (thread pools) so a crash in 'Image Service' doesn't kill 'Auth Service'.

topics.title: Saga Pattern
topics.note: Managing long-running transactions in microservices (Chreography vs Orchestration).

topics.title: Metrics (Prometheus/Grafana)
topics.note: Aggregatable data. 'What is the current CPU usage?' or 'Requests per second'.

topics.title: Logging (ELK Stack)
topics.note: Discrete events. 'Why did this specific request fail?' Structured logging is key.

topics.title: Distributed Tracing
topics.note: Visualizing the path of a request across 20 microservices (Jaeger/Zipkin).

topics.title: Heartbeats & Health Checks
topics.note: Liveness (Am I running?) vs Readiness (Can I accept traffic?).

topics.title: Design URL Shortener (TinyURL)
topics.note: Focus on: Unique ID generation (Base62), Database choice (NoSQL vs SQL), and heavy Read ratio.

topics.title: Design a Rate Limiter
topics.note: Focus on: Algorithms (Token Bucket), distributed counters (Redis), and where to place it (Gateway/Sidecar).

topics.title: Design a Chat System (WhatsApp)
topics.note: Focus on: WebSockets, preserving message order, offline storage, and 'Sent/Delivered/Read' status.

topics.title: Design a Notification Service
topics.note: Focus on: Pluggable providers (Email/SMS/Push), queues (RabbitMQ), and preventing spam.

topics.title: Design Uber/Lyft
topics.note: Focus on: Geospatial Indexing (QuadTrees/Geohash), high-frequency location updates, and matching logic.

topics.title: Design YouTube/Netflix
topics.note: Focus on: Chunked video streaming (HLS/DASH), CDNs, and transcoding pipeline.

topics.title: Design a Web Crawler
topics.note: Focus on: Politeness, handling cycles, DNS resolution, and massive deduplication (Bloom Filters).

topics.title: Design Google Drive/Dropbox
topics.note: Focus on: Block-level storage (chunking), synchronization logic, and revision history.

topics.title: Design a Payment System
topics.note: Focus on: Idempotency, ACID compliance, Reconciliation (Audit logs), and security.

topics.title: Google File System (GFS)
topics.note: The grandfather of HDFS. Defined how we handle Big Data storage.

topics.title: MapReduce
topics.note: Simplified distributed data processing. The basis for Hadoop.

topics.title: Dynamo (Amazon)
topics.note: Introduced the world to 'Consistent Hashing' and 'Vector Clocks' for high availability.
